title: Vayne needs a nerf
body:
Vayne, in her current state, cannot be allowed to exist. You can't itemize against her. If the idea is "build thornmail, frozen heart, and maybe randuins" to itemize against vayne that's ridiculous. 

Can you imagine if there was any other champion you wouldn't be MORE than fine if you built even TWO items against their damage let alone THREE (four if you count {{item:3047}} ). In addition, building any health  to counter whatever burst mid is pretty much negated once vayne gets off three auto attacks. How are tanks even supposed to remotely itemize against her? Is this considered balanced?

> How are tanks even supposed to remotely itemize against her? Is this considered balanced?

I'm not going to necessarily argue that Vayne isn't strong right now, but her current state isn't one that has been changed too dramatically in the past couple of years. If anything, it seems like just Vayne being the same Vayne we've known her to be all along.

To the best of my knowledge, Vayne wasn't seen as such a power pick even just a few months ago. As far as itemizing against her goes, you probably know that you have the same options against her as you do any other basic attacker, but I guess Silver Bolts just makes all your itemization choices feel bad? Silver Bolts reads as a spell that says "I'm a great tankbuster," so to me, to be upset that the spell seems to be doing its intended job begs the questions "Is it doing that job too well?" and/or "Is she doing other things too well?"

All that said, I'm not really sure what the appropriate measure, if any, to take on Vayne is.

Vayne has been relatively unchanged for the last year.

The thing is, rewind a year and we had super lane bullies like Graves, or Lucian in lane. And they dumpstered all over Vayne.

Over the course of the last year, just about every ADC has been nerfed, including all of Vayne's hardest counters, bringing her to the forefront.

You have to be a good Vayne tho in order to shine. Honestly I'd just buff other ADC's a bit.

Well, I'd have to agree with a few people on an oddity of Vayne: she gets base true damage in addition to the % health true damage.  But there's a reason why this is odd.

So Vayne's a tankbuster, right?  Does a % of true damage to an enemy's health.  This means that it's going to be super bloody effective against tanks and not quite so effective against squishier units.

But the thing about the base true damage is that that's hardly a scratch against tanks without the bonus base health damage.  This flat health damage actually harms _squishies_ more than tanks, and that's really bloody strange.  You then basically have a champ that's as efficient at destroying tanks as she is at assassinating people without retaliation.  That's nuts, especially considering she still builds ADC (with crit and damage), **on top of a damage steroid on her Q**.  She does _everything_ other ADC's do and far, far more.

The problem is very much that it makes all your itemization choices feel bad. Even though I know mathematically that building a Randuin's or Frozen Heart is going to help survive longer against her, after dying to her, and looking at the death recap, I feel like that was 3000g wasted. It's the same problem that Xerath had with his old siege mode magic pen. Yes, building magic defense items helped out a little, but it felt awful regardless. She feels very stat-checky, in the way that, as a tank, your only options against her are to blow her up or die regardless of what you build.

I think the primary issue is how heavily you have to build against a Vayne, as opposed to anything else. If the enemy team has a Vayne, and they are even equal with you, as a tank you HAVE to buy armor. You HAVE to purchase things like Thornmail, Randuins, Frozen Heart etc. It doesn't matter if the enemy team has an AP jungler, AP top, and AP mid, because if you don't build armor, Vayne will just murder you even if the entire rest of the team cannot. She is a one person AD threat equivalent to having an enemy team with Yi jungle and Zed mid.

It doesn't help that a lot of defensive items you would want to build against Vayne aren't actually as useful against her. Silver Bolts only becomes stronger as you buy health, therefore punishing the tanks for... building tanky. That one thing that is their job remember? Yeah, it more heavily punishes them for doing that. Add to the fact that Vayne will almost ALWAYS buy a BotRK, and as soon as you finish your Randuins Omen you are probably weaker against her than when you started. This is NOT a good feeling.

Now, whether Vayne is OP or not I can't say, but I will say that she makes any tanky enemy feel really bad about their whole build path, and makes their job significantly harder than against any other matchup in the game.

The problem that is that she is rather limited in what she does, it all boils down to 'get in 550 range and right-click the shit out of them'
Since reaching and staying in 550 range is rather delicate for a squishy, she has some tools to reach that range and stay where without instantly getting delteted.
The problem with that is that she is really, really bad if her tools aren't sufficent in a given situation to stay alive in 550range, as she now has to choose between not doing anything or straight up dieing...
However, if her tools are sufficient, she feels like the untouchable queen of death.
This leads to her fealing opressing whenever she does work, even though she isn't generally OP as there are just enough scenarios in which she doesn't work.
However, people won't remember the games in which the enemie vayne did 2 AAs in the entier teamfight cause she was to afraid of dieing, or the games in which she tumbled in, did 1 AA and instandly blew up afterwards(unless that vayne is on your own team ofc)
But people Remember games in which there team probably had poor focus and vayne cpould kill them 1 by 1 for an casual Penta, they remember the games in which Garren+Sion gett killed bay a vayne that was 0/3/1 just cuase Vaynes biggest power is killing tanky stuff while kiteing melees, so she was put into a scenario that played perfectly to her strengths.
She is a Hardcounter vs specific champs, and that is something damn frustraiting no matter how balanced she is overall(same for kallista and her cursed passive)

So her current job seems to be 'beeing overhelming if allowed to AA freely', but with 550 range AAing freely isn't always an option and she's usless if she can't do her job.
The %-true damage and tankbusting thing just adds to the 'beeing overhelming' part, if she is allowed to AA freely, it doesn't matter who she AAs, with 70bonus ad from ult, great base stats for an adc and her Q, she can 2-3shot squishys with 2+AS, while her W shreds down tanks.

so yea, by that definition of her job, she does her job to damn well, while she also is to weak if she can't do her job.
The flat true damage portion of Silver Bolts does too much to squishies for a tankbuster.

> How are tanks even supposed to remotely itemize against her? Is this considered balanced?

Vayne has always had %max HP true damage, and as far as I can remember it's always been 8% at max rank. It's something Riot's defended on several occasions, and there nerfs to her kit have hit everything else besides it when they've needed to address her.

The bulk of Vayne's damage is physical auto-attack based due in large part to her ult's steroid and Tumble's bonus damage as well, which {{item:3143}} {{item:3082}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3047}} all hit with a double-whammy.

-------------------

As for her true damage, consider:
A) LoL is a game reliant on skill and using tactics and stratagy to a certain extent
B) No tactic or stratagy works 100% of the time in LoL

You can't dodge point-click skills with mobility.
You can't land point-click skills on opponents in fog of war, stealth, brush, invisibility, stasis, or untargetability.
You can't use Tenacity or Cleanse vs. slowing fields, knockbacks, pulls, suppression, or knockups.
You can't damage invulnerable targets or targets that refuse to drop below 1 hp.
You can't rely on out-tanking someone that's tankier than you.
You can't rely on out-running someone that's speedier than you.
You can't rely on out-ranging someone with more range than you.

The answer to every champion simply isn't just counter-build them even if you are a tank or fighter capable of doing so.

With Vayne counter-building her will force close to 37.5 AAs with her %max HP ture damage alone though.
This is in a game where Nasus can 2-shot a squishy, so it's not like counter-building her damage does nothing. You just don't get to be invulnerable vs. her if she manages to hit you 30+ times, and she gets to do something if she manages to survive within 550 range of you long enough.

----------

In regards to fighters - getting within striking distance of her as a tanky DPS like Nasus, Shyvana, Warwick, Olaf, or Udyr and flat out killing Vayne is your stratagy. Difficult if you telegraph your movements and get immobilized by the enemy team. Not particularly difficult if you use walls, brush, fog of war, and/or wards to approach her from a difficult angle and land a few hits. She's a solid chaser, not a great runner.

In regards to tanks - Vayne is the highest priority target on the enemy team to lock down with CC. Her front-loaded burst is pretty low and her damage contribution will rapidly climb the longer she's allowed to auto-attack, which most CC prevents her from doing. Vayne's defensive mechanic is mostly reliant on out-maneuvering her foes as well, which CC generally stops.

In most cases true CC tanks counter Vayne much harder than she counters them, seeing as most are amazing at initiating a team-fight and locking down priority targets, where Vayne is a mediocre team-fighter by most accounts and does not handle being locked down very well.

-----

Anyways - don't assume defense is always the answer. In regards to a lot of bruisers and fighter/tanks it's pretty useless as well, darn hybridized physical/magical/auto-attack/ability damage output.

But every champion has different strengths and weaknesses. Your job is to find them out, exploit their weaknesses, and avoid their strengths. Not try to muscle your way past their strengths with your weaknesses.
